Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Server
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FTPServer, HTTPServer, IMAPServer, POP3Server, SMTPServer
    public abstract class Server
extends Connector
    Abstract base class for server connectors that listen on ports. A server in Gumdrop terminology corresponds exactly to a server in common internet parlance: it is a service running and listening on a specific port for client connections.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

        Returns:
        the idle timeout in milliseconds

      • setIdleTimeoutMs

        public void setIdleTimeoutMs​(long idleTimeoutMs)
        Sets the idle timeout in milliseconds. Connections with no activity for this duration may be closed.
        Parameters:
        idleTimeoutMs - the idle timeout in milliseconds (0 to disable)

      • setIdleTimeout

        public void setIdleTimeout​(java.lang.String timeout)
        Sets the idle timeout using a string with optional time unit suffix. Supported suffixes: ms, s, m, h (milliseconds, seconds, minutes, hours). Examples: "30s", "5m", "300000ms"
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout string

      • getReadTimeoutMs

        public long getReadTimeoutMs()
        Returns the read timeout in milliseconds. If no data is received for this duration during an active read, the connection may be closed.
        Returns:
        the read timeout in milliseconds

        Returns:
        the connection timeout in milliseconds

      • setMaxConnectionsPerIP

        public void setMaxConnectionsPerIP​(int max)
        Sets the maximum concurrent connections allowed per IP address.

        When set to a positive value, connections from an IP address will be rejected if that IP already has the maximum number of active connections. Set to 0 to disable concurrent connection limiting.

        Parameters:
        max - the maximum concurrent connections per IP (0 to disable)

      • setRateLimit

        public void setRateLimit​(java.lang.String rateLimit)
        Sets the connection rate limit.

        Format: count/duration, where duration supports suffixes:

        • s - seconds
        • m - minutes
        • h - hours

        Examples: 100/60s (100 per minute), 1000/1h (1000 per hour)

        Parameters:
        rateLimit - the rate limit string

      • setMaxAuthFailures

        public void setMaxAuthFailures​(int max)
        Sets the maximum failed authentication attempts before lockout.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum failures before lockout

      • setAuthLockoutTime

        public void setAuthLockoutTime​(java.lang.String duration)
        Sets the authentication lockout duration.

        Format: duration with suffix: s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours). Example: 5m (5 minutes)

        Parameters:
        duration - the lockout duration

      • setAllowedNetworks

        public void setAllowedNetworks​(java.lang.String allowedNetworks)
        Sets allowed networks in CIDR notation (comma-separated). Supports both IPv4 and IPv6 networks.

        When configured, only connections from these networks will be accepted. If no allowed networks are configured, connections from any network are accepted (unless blocked).

        Parameters:
        allowedNetworks - networks to allow (e.g., "192.168.1.0/24,2001:db8::/32,10.0.0.0/8")
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any CIDR format is invalid

      • setBlockedNetworks

        public void setBlockedNetworks​(java.lang.String blockedNetworks)
        Sets blocked networks in CIDR notation (comma-separated). Supports both IPv4 and IPv6 networks.

        Connections from blocked networks are rejected before any other filtering rules are applied.

        Parameters:
        blockedNetworks - networks to block (e.g., "192.168.100.0/24,2001:db8:bad::/48")
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any CIDR format is invalid

      • getAllowedCIDRs

        protected java.util.List<CIDRNetwork> getAllowedCIDRs()
        Returns the list of allowed CIDR networks.
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of allowed networks

      • getBlockedCIDRs

        protected java.util.List<CIDRNetwork> getBlockedCIDRs()
        Returns the list of blocked CIDR networks.
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of blocked networks

      • acceptConnection

        public boolean acceptConnection​(java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteAddress)
        Determines whether to accept a connection from the specified remote address. This method is called for each incoming connection before resources are allocated.

        The default implementation applies the following filters in order:

        1. Blocked CIDR networks (explicit deny)
        2. Allowed CIDR networks (if configured, explicit allow only)
        3. Connection rate limiting (if configured)

        Subclasses can override to add additional filtering policies but should call super.acceptConnection(remoteAddress) to apply standard filtering.

        Parameters:
        remoteAddress - the remote socket address attempting to connect
        Returns:
        true to accept the connection, false to reject it

      • connectionClosed

        public void connectionClosed​(java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteAddress)
        Called when a connection is closed to update rate limiting tracking.

        Subclasses should call this method when connections are closed to maintain accurate concurrent connection counts.

        Parameters:
        remoteAddress - the remote address of the closed connection

      • isAuthLocked

        public boolean isAuthLocked​(java.net.InetAddress ip)
        Checks if the specified IP address is locked out due to failed authentication.
        Parameters:
        ip - the IP address to check
        Returns:
        true if the IP is locked out

      • recordAuthFailure

        Parameters:
        ip - the IP address of the failed attempt

                              java.lang.String username)
        Records a failed authentication attempt for a specific user.
        Parameters:
        ip - the IP address of the failed attempt
        username - the username that was attempted

      • recordAuthSuccess

        public void recordAuthSuccess​(java.net.InetAddress ip)
        Records a successful authentication, clearing any failure tracking.
        Parameters:
        ip - the IP address of the successful authentication
